item.title: Copy ssh keys without ssh-copy-id
item.description: I ran into this issue today so I thought that i would put a solution that I found on here. If you ever run into a situation in which you need to copy your ssh keys to another box but you dont have the handy dandy ssh-copy-id tool, the following one liner should work. Check out this oracle web page for more info. cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub | ssh <USER>@<IP> 'cat >> .

item.title: Pull public keys from Github url
item.description: If you ever want a simple way to pull your public keys from Github so that you can use your safely stored ssh private keys where you need them. curl https://github.com/[USERNAME].keys This command will put it in your authorized_keys file which will actually allow you to use them in ssh. curl https://github.com/[USERNAME].keys | tee -a ~/.ssh/authorized_keys
